text.headline: Written notes threatening NALL
text.text: 01/13/1983 - Written notes, threatening NALL and coommunity as a group, left at Womonfyre Books. "The paper is right, homosexual people must be eradicated. S.H.U.N. - Stop homosexual Unity Now" and 'NALL will never exist, Gays must be persecuted". ("the paper" refers to an editorial by Joseph Sobran published in the Daily Hampshire Gazette which was viciously antigay).

text.headline: A threat is received
text.text: A threat is received on a tape machine at a local business threatening to kill, first to the coordinator of NALL, then to Kiriyo Spooner, and third to burn Womonfyre Books. The message is received on Saturday and they say that the store will be burned on Tuessday. The store is under 24 hour surveilance for the next 3 days, and for the 2 Tuesdays thereafter.

text.headline: Heramedia come to Northampton
text.text: Heramedia, Lesbian Video Project from NYC, comes to Northampton to film Lesbian & Gay Liberation March, victims of harassment (Kiriyo Spooner, Bet Birdfish, Kim Chistiansen) on location in Leeds at NALL & at Womonfyre Books for project on Lesbians & violence

text.headline: 2nd Annual Lesbian and Gay Liberation March
text.text: over 2,000 march

text.headline: The bookstore gets egged
text.text: The bookstore gets egged on May 28th, May 29th, July 8th, October, December 27th, January 29th, 1984 and April 23, 1984

text.headline: SHUN call to VWV
text.text: threatens all lesbian and gay groups with violence

text.headline: Daily Hampshire Gazette runs its 4-part series on lesbians
Jil Krolik sets up a trap
text.text: Jil Krolik of Womonfyre Books sets up a trap for the phone harasser by heavily advertising a reading by Becky Births scheduled for August 5 at the store. The ads list Jills home phone as the information number. The District Attorney's office provides a telephone answering machine, and Jil stays at home to note the time of phone calls. Approximately 35 phone calls from a group of local kids are received. Three phone calls from SHUN are also received on July 30. Robert Kremensky is arrested August 5 for thos calls.

text.headline: SC administration attempts to gain control over contents of SCLA's workshops
text.text: SC administration attempts to gain control over contents of SCLA's workshops because of pressure from Alumni and Trustees to deal with the "Lesbian Problem".

text.headline: New Alexandria Lesbian Library moves to Northamtpon
FBI Grand Jury Community Education Coalition started in Northampton
text.text: "Fall"

text.headline: Thirteenth Moon
text.text: A witch supply store opens at 56 Main St. in Northampton

text.headline: "Lesbians and Health"
text.text: a workshop sponsored by SCLA at SC

text.headline: Kremensky is convicted
text.text: Kremensky is convicted of violating the civil rights of 3 lesbians and is sentenced to one year in jail (with all but 3 months suspended.) This is the first jail sentence under the state civil rights law for a violation of a gay person's civil rights.

text.text: (Gay/Lesbian Informational Support Services of Springfield)
